intro: Mezoneuron oxyphyllum, commonly known as the white-flowered mezoneuron, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Mezoneuron oxyphyllum is often found in moist, open habitats such as woodlands and wetlands.
